meanings.definition: To work for an expert to learn a trade or skill
meanings.sent1: She is apprenticing with a baker to learn how to make bread.
meanings.sent2: He is apprenticing under a carpenter to become a skilled woodworker.
meanings.sent3: While apprenticing with the chef, she accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: His time apprenticing with the blacksmith forged his passion for metalworking.
meanings.sent5: Apprenticing with the tailor painted a colorful picture of the fashion industry for her.

meanings.definition: The act of being an apprentice
meanings.sent1: His apprenticeship with the mechanic was a valuable experience.
meanings.sent2: She completed her apprenticing at the pottery studio last month.
meanings.sent3: The cat's 'apprenticing' under the dog to learn how to fetch was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The young artist's apprenticing in the art gallery was like a journey through creativity.
meanings.sent5: The boy's apprenticing in the bakery filled his days with the sweet aroma of freshly baked goods.
